title: Racism is OK
body:
Just direct it at the Australians and your fine.

https://image.prntscr.com/image/mjiZKjdVQoic_PvGvKnFiw.png

Not only is the General Boards community Upvoting this racism (because like in the pic, it was -3)

But Riot is yet to do anything to this post, or any of the similar posts, and it's been 2 days, and 1 whole business day.

You can't control your boards, why on earth do you expect me to believe that you can control in game toxicity?

Fact is, I've realised i can't even have a standard conversation on here without being down-voted by people who don't care what i say, and you know what, i don't care.

Opinions aren't really allowed on this boards anymore, because if you dare have an opinion and aren't diamond, you can get down-voted or ridiculed for no reason.

And this sort of behaviour is acceptable.

Well you know what?

Fuck you.

That is directed at all the people who do this sort of shit, who allow Racism and Attacks based on rank happen on these boards, while refusing to do much of anything about it.

Riot OCE, i know you read these posts and refuse to respond, but you can damn well know that we also know you read this.

replies.body: The comments in one of the comment threads somehow devolved into some sort of social debate. I don't think that was a conversation that anyone wanted to be a part of, and I'll likely be starting a discussion on whether topics like these are welcome on the Boards. If anyone has any thoughts on the matter, I'd be more than happy to receive them.

100% my bad.
Poor wording on my behalf.

The funny thing about Broken Script's comment is not only was he Racist but he also used your rank as an excuse to judge your intelligence OUTSIDE of the game. Excuse me but some people don't play League for 12 hours every single day. 

For my opinion on the main topic though, and judging by the amount of "Racist" comments I've had deleted by Riot on these boards (which mind you make up 90% of the total comments I've had deleted over the many years I've been on here which goes to show maybe I'm not as wrong about everything I say as you think), I would say YES these kinds of people irritate me and YES I do agree that if you're going to play on an English speaking server you SHOULD know some basic form of English, as League is a game that HEAVILY relies on teamwork and communication it is vital that everyone on your team can understand each other. 

But should foreigners be reported for the assumption that they are flaming you? No, that's Prejudice, and that's unfair. 

A way to solve something like this (Because just blatantly BANNING people from outside the country from entering our server is stupid seeing as people from OCE play on NA and other servers etc) would be a little tricky, but I have an idea that possibly could be implemented. If Riot could somehow have a translator for the in-game chat that automatically translates other languages into the desired language that has been set in your client, or maybe if having something like a translator that is always running is too much workload for the server it could be an in-game setting to toggle on/off, or a button that translates what has been typed so far in chat. Something to make it easier for universal communication, even though the multiple League servers were created to solve this issue there's not much that can be done for random foreigners who won't stay on their own server and would much rather put up with the lag.

That's a very interesting idea. A lot of translators can be dodgy but you should be able to get a relatively bare bones one working without a humongous load on the server. Obviously it wouldn't enable full communication just basic phrases and stuff that gets used a lot. Problem might come in the number of languages you include. The workload on the server would rise pretty dramatically based on the number of languages. 

Another option might be some kind of macro phrase book. Kind of like pings to say a specific phrase in this specific language. Obviously since people would have to choose to use it you'd still get people ignoring it. But it would offer an alternative to get your point across. A stop gap if you will if a translation feature is to demanding on the servers.

Even a dodgy translator would be fine, I mean, i'm fine with the people who speak broken english, because they are at least trying to communicate.

And it wouldn't have a huge load on the server likely at all, because you'd be able to implement it in a way that you just translate between the languages that people have already chosen (so a limit of 10, and likely a lot less.) through the client, and just enable people to actually pick their language in client (not currently a feature for OCE)

I guess it would depend if it was placed inside the client or on the server. Either way its another step or two which the chat must be run through, which when being used at peak times could create strain. I think its an interesting idea that deserves looking at. Especially since theirs some short cuts you could take to get something workable up. Not sure a full translation is viable though, Riot are the only people who have the numbers that could tell us.

I never actually got around to posting this due to a few reasons.

This thread is actually breaking the rules and no moderator has done anything about it for some reason.

1. This is naming and shaming. He intentionally left my name in the picture because he's petty and it's an attack. He clearly took the thread into paint, so he could have blocked my name out, but he didn't. Why? Because he wanted to try and get me punished. Simple as that. This is an obvious sign of rule breaking and it wasn't addressed at all. I have been banned and punished for less than this. I mentioned the guy's initials and had my post removed.

2. Following point one, this is, no matter how you take it, a direct attack against my person. He plastered my name in the image and tied the entire post to it. This is not towards anyone but me. He added other small points that don't contribute anything, but this thread is nothing than a poorly masked attack.

3. There's clearly offensive language in the post and nothing has been done. OP complains about toxicity yet his own post is toxic. It's alright for him to curse, right?

-

Summary? This is nothing but a petty attack on me because the OP is salty that I trolled him and he's mad. He turned a small deal into a big one and cried about toxicity, even though he himself is toxic, abusive, and the instigator of the situation. Remember, he reports people for not speaking English. Beleive it or not, but that's racism. I think that's a tad more extreme than me pointing out facts you can find on Wikipedia. Go ahead, I'll wait. Australia's history is listed there and everything I said is true.

Peace!

I'll admit, you have a point. Looking at the original post in this thread with your comments in mind, there's clearly been more than one flaw in the moderation of this particular chain of issues. Going to be blunt here, I didn't notice the name in the screenshot Jason provided. I knew who's post it was showing, so I wasn't paying any mind to whether the name was visible. Can't speak for the Rioter(s) or the other volunteers on that, but I wouldn't be surprised if they did the same thing (we should probably work on that, though).

That's not to say it's any less inappropriate behaviour. I've brought this up internally, will be working to have this resolved ASAP. Keep in mind, Jason did (and still does) have a point. The comment in question is racist, and racism is no more appropriate than offensive language or naming and shaming. Their presentation of the issue, however, could definitely use some work (so could yours, to be honest).

I just want to take a moment here to address this comment:
> he reports people for not speaking English. Beleive it or not, but that's racism.

When it comes down to it, the players can and do have a say in what they report. Thing is, Riot encourages players to report anything they *suspect* of breaking the rules, even if that means they're reporting people who are speaking in another language because they're under the suspicion (or, in this case, assumption) those players are using offensive language, slurs (of various types), harassment, and other forms of inappropriate chat use. I wouldn't say that makes someone racist, rather that they prefer that the chat be checked for inappropriate behaviour despite their own ignorance of the language(s) in question.

Keep in mind, racism is defined as "Prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism directed against someone of a different race based on the belief that one's own race is superior." (via the Oxford Dictionary), which doesn't really fit into this situation. No one so far has said they report because of race/ethnicity (even nationality), but rather because they don't know what's being said and would rather something be done *if* it needs to be. The reasons certain people feel that way may be morally questionable, but that shouldn't detract from the point that it's not a matter of racism to be reporting in such a fashion.

Also wasn't your name pink 

Edit or was it purple. I'm having a hard time remembering 

Did you get a promotion? Congrats

Yeh, my name was purple. As Wuks said, I was bumped up to an Emissary (green name, obviously) from a Distinguished Member (purple name).

Honestly, I miss my purple name (purple is my favourite colour).
Congrats dude. Though it will take some getting used to. It's just so different haha

We bumped HeartVine up from a Distinguished Member to an Emissary :)

Well deserved, no doubt.

While I understand riots stance on reporting if you suspect something is wrong this is different. He specifically admitted he reported anyone using anything other than English, his exact words were:

"I honestly just report use of any other language in game.

If i can't tell what your saying, i'm gonna assume your insulting me and give you a report."

That is racist, he's reporting people based on them using a language other than English. Automatically assuming someone is insulting you because there not speaking English is incredibly demeaning. Don't you think the people reported would feel "Prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism" if they found out some of there reports were based not on toxicity but simply on the fact they were speaking something other than English. How is this any different than those video we get every couple of month of someone on public transport screaming "Speak English" to someone of color minding there own business.

If you understand a couple of words and think there saying something insulting fair enough. If there switching between broken English insulting you and another language, fair enough. If you report someone simply for using another language your saying only English speakers should be allowed here. And that is racist.

That's not Racist.

Fact is, if they aren't insulting me, the report means nothing.

So finding out "some of the reports were based on not speaking english" isn't really a matter in this case.

Yes it is. Weather they get punished is immaterial. That's like calling the police cause you saw some people of color hanging around and then saying "It's not racist cause if there not doing anything wrong they won't be punished". Your reporting people simply because they're different from you, not cause there doing anything wrong. It's racist and ridiculous.

> I didn't notice the name in the screenshot Jason provided. I knew who's post it was showing, so I wasn't paying any mind to whether the name was visible. Can't speak for the Rioter(s) or the other volunteers on that, but I wouldn't be surprised if they did the same thing (we should probably work on that, though).

I'll be honest this is my bad, i'll make a new one with it covered up and repost the image, as a personal attack wasn't my aim with this post.

"Racism is ok as long as you can take racism yourself" (Not exact quote)

It's bad all around man, wtf is wrong with you

I think you misunderstand my point here.
That is nothing like what I said.

No racism is ever okay.
Just like kicking a pet is never okay.

But if you put all your time, money and effort into kiting out the pet police. You have none left to spend on keeping the Tigers from going extinct. 

So all I'm saying is that we only have so much sway in the world, why spend so much of it on snarky comments online said in the heat of the moment, when you could spend it on actually trying to fix brutal violent race crimes elsewhere.

What are you saying?

So instead of focusing on removing racism form league we should NOT do that but rather focus it on something else?

Your a bloody Volunteer, its partially your job to help remove it from the boards and in game, not incite it.

We have the means necessary to remove it from the " Pet police, and the tigers".
YOUR suppose to help clear the boards, while riot focuses on the game.

I have never incited racism!
You are completely misunderstanding what I'm saying here.

Racism is a terrible thing, I would in no way ever condone it.
Im not saying that at all. 90% of the post was actually talking about how we ignore too much racism.

I was talking more about real world problems and our reactions to them.
My point was just because people spit in your face, doesn't mean you have to spit back. That just escalates a bad situation.

But I've deleted the comment now if that makes you feel better.

I'm sure it was not your intention, but when I read it it felt like you were downplaying certain types of racism I.e.: comparing racism against minorities as being more profound than with this case against stereotypical "Australians"

So I guess it didn't really read well.
The point to keep in mind is that this particular instance has been brought up, we got a response and hopefully Riot can do something about improving the reporting systems in the future, as well as noting when these cases of racism do pop up in the future to be more prompt and report them.

Yes I understand my wording was extremely sub-par... :S

I apologise!

To me you incited it by the whole "You can do racism if you can take it".
Not directly, I just found that kind of thing stupid.

But we weren't talking about "Real World Problems" we were talking about racism in league/boards.

And we didn't "Spit Back" we posted examples of racism done to "White" people and it seemed to be fine, and no one was doing anything. People were upvoting it.

The way you worded everything just seemed to be stupid. as Jonius said, you worded it poorly.
Riot had already stepped in, and you just seemed to make everything worse.

> "You can do racism if you can take it"

I never said anything of the sort!

I said people need to learn to 'give and take.' as in know when to just accept that its just some kid in a moment of frustration, and not actually some KKK member out to get you. and know when to strike back against true racism.
But yea I obviously worded everything very poorly and I'm sorry for that.
Seriously dude, there is a rioter here saying there is an issue with their report system, and here you are trying to PR this into being something good, just stop.

> Opinions aren't really allowed on this boards anymore

You couldn't be more right aye!

Ive deleted the comment, seeming everyone seems to be so offended.
I never said it was good! I think you are wayyy misunderstanding me.
I mean your opinion is more "This Racism is fine get over it there is worse"

No racism is ever fine! 
but some kinds are indeed worse than others

You cant deny, you'd rather have this comment said to you, than be beaten bloody on the streets.
Therefore if I had 10 points of _"fix racism power"_ id rather put all 10 of them into stopping people being beaten, than stopping insecure people online making hollow jabs.

Im not saying that it isn't bad, nor am I saying that you should just get over it.
Im saying the bigger the fuss we make of this hollow surface-level stuff, the more emphasis we take away from the subject as a whole.

Like feminism for example, true feminism is a great cause, gender equality is absolutely essential! But because of so many 'over-the-top' feminists who are more about revenge on men than actual equality, the word 'Feminism' has pretty much become a joke.

It was only my intention to stop that happening with Racism.
Im really sorry I didn't word it well, I had no intention of belittling racism on league.

The thing is, we don't have a limit to the amount of racism we can fix.

And honestly there is a slight difference between Feminism in this case and Racism in this case.

Feminist's (the non-Male hating ones) don't just magically get their hate on for males.

However Racism can escalate from minor racism into people being beaten.

Fact is according to Maraudaur, this comes down to an issue with their reporting system (how is still a question but one i doubt will be answered).


And one thing you said in your post is that there has to be give and take or we all become Grey, and i believe that is just opposite to the whole stance against Racism.

Us not being black or white doesn't make everyone the same, stopping Racism just means that we won't discriminate rather then the world being boring, it will open up opportunities for everyone, regardless of race.

When I said give and take, I didin't mean it in terms of "giving some racism is fine. ". thats never okay.
I meant it as theres a certain threshold of things that you can live with being said and some that you cant live with.

and the higher the threshold, the happier you are.

Some people get into bar fights just because someone called their mum a bad name.
Yea its unpleasant, but just because they said it, doesn't mean its true, and if its not true,  is it really worth getting into a punch up? You defended your mum against a false slur she will never know about, and now you live the rest of your life with a crooked nose.

Thats all I meant, I'm sorry.
We are both anti-racism here.
Good to know that of the two, a Rioter is the one that is actually concerned and not the volunteer

I haven't got long so I'll only give a quick response. Yes, it was our bad. We haven't been as active as we could have been (at least on my part) and so things were slipping under the radar. We need to step up our moderation game, and as Broken Scripts brought up, your post broke the naming and shaming rule so I've edited it accordingly (which you have addressed with HeartVine).

As for the upvotes, I expect they had more to do with the rest of the comment than the racist part itself. People were agreeing with his side of the "is it ok to report people for speaking another language" more than the particular comment in question.

There are very few Rioters who actually monitor OCE boards, and they have very limited time. It is why we introduced volunteer mods, but being volunteers we aren't paid to do this and all have our own lives and jobs as well. That aside however it is true we have been getting lax and are working to fix that.

>You can't control your boards, why on earth do you expect me to believe that you can control in game toxicity?

The people who handle boards toxicity and those that handle in game are entirely separate. Gehirn is the closest to doing both since he's the PS lead, but it should be fairly obvious that us volunteers (who are the bulk of moderators) have no involvement with in game PB stuff. But ye, it does create a bad image.

>Fact is, I've realised i can't even have a standard conversation on here without being down-voted by people who don't care what i say, and you know what, i don't care.

I can't speak for everyone else, but I suspect you get constant downvotes because of the way you present your arguments, more than the content itself. If you are calling out or abusing the community you are trying to appeal to then chances are you are going to be dismissed as negative and noone is going to bother to actually read your discussion.

>who allow ... Attacks based on rank

I at least am going to be taking a harder stance on this in the future.

>i know you read these posts and refuse to respond

Refusing to respond and not having the time to read and respond *properly* are two different things. I'd rather give you no response at all than a two sentence one that doesn't address even half your concerns.
betcha a rioter will take this down real quick.

I can assure you, we won't be removing this thread. It's good to maintain a healthy feedback loop, and if we close discussions regarding moderation concerns, it doesn't help you or us. We're re-evaluating our moderation practices to ensure this doesn't happen again. If you have any criticisms or other feedback, I hope you can feel comfortable enough to post it.

Sorry about being emotional and snarky. It just felt like issues about racist threads and posts were being ignored (though I just now realised there is a 'report' button after over a year of being on the boards because I'm a very observant person).

No worries. Comments like the one in the OP are inflammatory by nature, so I completely understand where you're coming from. All in all, I appreciate you taking the time here to give your thoughts and further appreciate the apology. Thank you!
Wait so was it moderation practices being an issue, or was it that the report didn't materialise?

At this time, I think there's a potential that it was both. For whatever reason, the report wasn't appearing on our end until earlier today; I, personally, noticed it this morning, but I chose to tackle the Help & Support backlog before reviewing the moderation reports. For this latter part, I can take responsibility for this oversight.

Hi JasonWazza,

I'm sorry that we missed that comment. Racism is definitely **NOT** okay or condoned on the boards. I want to talk a little bit about how we moderate the boards. We can't read every discussion and comment on the boards so we rely heavily on the report button. When a post or comment is reported it surfaces on a moderation queue that we review and action. Please ensure you report posts that you find inappropriate or offensive and we will review them. If you did report it please let us know as this post did not appear in the moderation queue and we would have to investigate why that may be.

In future please do continue using the report function on the boards as this helps us a lot when it comes to cleaning up inappropriate posts.

https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/images/oce/Community/Boards/Postimages/report%20button.PNG

When discussing topics I too hope we can use logic and reason rather than personal attacks.

>If you haven't already, you should use the report feature to report the racist comment you're referring to (I'll admit, I did this the moment I saw it, and I'm hoping you did too).

This is heartvine, i also reported it.
I will investigate what happened there. I have deleted the comment now.

So people speaking another language are allowed to flame us English speakers and avoid the trigger words that cause punishments on accounts??? Brb learning Chinese so I can molest my team mates with bad language and avoid getting banned.  Thanks riot :)

Regardless of language, behaviour that is found to be negative and/or toxic will be identified by the Instant Feedback System and will result in punishments. IFS operates through machine learning, so if you see behaviour that isn't in line with community standards, you should definitely report that behaviour. 

This discussion, however, pertains to the Boards, so this system isn't necessarily relevant here. If you want to discuss this further, I'd recommend dropping a post in the [Player Behaviour](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour) board.
